Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaycee2053
Reviews.Content: The room was nice but just average The parking was strange. you have to walk outside behind the hotel to get back into the hotel. There isn't much room in the front driveway to load and unload

Reviews.Title: “Nice property - needs some TLC in areas”
Reviews.Author: Landylady50
Reviews.Content: Typical Hilton property - nice lobby, pool and parking structure. Room was spacious with 2 beds and a small sofa which converts into a bed. Bedding was nice and beds were comfortable. The sofa is in very poor state and should in no way be in a Hilton property. The arm was completely peeled away where people have obviously had their hands over the years. I took pictures with my cell phone but am unable to upload into this review. The walls also seem paper thin between rooms and you can hear what is going on even to a point of listening to conversations. There is a restaurant in the lobby, however, we did not use this. Price was typical of what you get when you are with a large group. Parking is $16/night however it was included in our rate so we did not have to deal with that part.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room”
Reviews.Author: Hoya79
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent deluxe room with 2 queen beds, a sofa and a balcony. It was very nice, clean and quiet. The water pressure in the shower was great. The pool was nice as was the fitness center. I also used the business center to print my airline boarding passes. Two items to note: this hotel does not have a shuttle to the San Diego airport and it charges a nightly parking fee ($16/night).

Reviews.Title: “Good for Family”
Reviews.Author: sofcal
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 5 nights in the hotel. A family with 3 children. We stayed in the kids suite and it was perfect for us. The hotel is very clean and the service was perfect every day. The front desk staff was helpful everytime even though they were always busy. No problem parking the car in the parkade. We had breakfast only once at the hotel. It is overpriced. We preferred to drive to a nearby bakery every morning. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Why did I do this?”
Reviews.Author: jasontraci2006
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and gambled-- I should have trusted the reviews. I am a Hilton Diamond member that means I spend about 40 stays at Hilton each year. Upon check in, I was not welcomed as a diamond member and did not receive a room upgrade. I was given passes for breakfast but based on reviews here, I wasn't paying 8.95 for each child and 13.00 for each other adult. Pros: Hotel is near other hotels such as motel 6, comfort inn, ramada inn. They had a fire pit and small seating outside. Hotel is located 10 mins from zoo. Cons: 16.00 charge per night for parking. The parking garage is very narrow-here's a tip-drive to rear of garage and park. The onsite food pantry had beer, cokes, ice cream, juices, wine, but no milk. We had to buy that for 3.00 per glass in the restaurant. Rip off. We found a target down the street for the next night. The pool was heated but small.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCroz
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree in Mission Valley is much nicer. This Doubletree is dated but no real negatives. I had dinner and breakfast at the hotel. Breakfast was good but do yourself a favor and go out for dinner. Parking is $16/nights which seems excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Adam J
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree on Hotel circle is only about 10minutes from downtown San Diego and 10minutes from San Diego Intl. Airport. It is very clean and the rooms seem recently renovated(within the last few years). The pool/hot tub area is very nice and also has a fire pitarea with lots of seating. The breakfast was your typical hotel waffles,potatoes,eggs, and bran goods. Beds are VERY comfortable! Downfalls of this property are: Close to busy highway so dont plan on sleeping with your patio door open. $16 a day parking

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: kitcat_uk
Reviews.Content: I didn't have any complaints with this hotel, it was surprisingly quiet being next to the freeway which was good. The location is very convenient with everything nearby. The bed maybe could have been a bit more comfortable but the shower and room cleaning were good. I can see why people say the parking is not that great, it is very tight but we managed just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: Had a nice time at this hotel for 2 nights. I was able to check in early and that was great. I ate at their restaurant 2 times, and both times service and food were great. The hotel is a short distance to a nice shopping mall where there's a Cheesecake Factory.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: SoCalGringo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel when traveling to San Diego for a hockey tournament. The hotel met our expectations. It is centrally located, the pool was nice, we were happy with the breakfast, the rooms were clean and we got a very affordable group rate that included parking and breakfast. I was not bothered by it, but similar to other reviews if you are a lousy driver you may not want to stay here due to the parking garage. For us, the worst thing about the hotel was the hotel pizza. It was lousy.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, central location, quiet, and great rate.”
Reviews.Author: WallaCoug
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a business trip to San Diego driving down from Washington. We checked in very early (1 AM), and the staff was courteous and very welcoming. The entry had a very nice waterfall and made the arrival very inviting even though it was not a resort hotel. The parking garage was well lit even though getting in late. The room was clean and had a nice view of the courtyard and had a seperate sitting room which was a great feature. The bed was very comfortable. The one time we had need of assistance at our room, the service was there within a couple minutes; very quick. The hotel is within 5 minutes of the Zoo, Balboa Park, Sea World, and most of the museums. Two minutes further to downtown. 5 minutes to Qualcomm Stadium. Great central location and a great value, fantastic shopping right across the street at Fashion Valley. If you need a high quality hotel right in the heart of the action, this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...not what I am used to from Hilton properties.”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I am a Gold Hilton Honors member so I stay in lots of Hilton family hotels. The driveway was being resurfaced the weekend I stayed so entering and leaving the garage was hazardous. On top of that, the parking garage is scary - I rented a Nissan Altima (a mid-sized car) and I held my breath going around the corners in the garage because they were so tight. Ditto for the parking spaces. I grew up in NYC so I know how to navigate tight spaces, but this garage is ridiculous! Hotel room was OK. Breakfast buffet was free since I an a Gold HHonors member which is good because I had to ask repeatedly for my omelet and I was finished wating the rest of my breakfast when it arrived. I asked the front desk staff for a recommendation for a good, authentic Mexican restaurant and they pulled out "the list" which I told them I wasn't interested in. Then the bellman gave me another restaurant recommendation that was probably worse than those on "the list." Location is convenient to the interstate highway and Old Town but there is really nothing in the area. DEFINITELY would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kuuru
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night due to a convention that was in town that I had to attend. First impression was....the parking garage is horrible. Don't rent an SVU, if you can rent a small compact car so you can navigate the tiny ramps up the parking garage. Since I arrived late I had to park up top. There was no security. I saw the security guard hanging out in the lobby flirting with the front desk staff. Oh and the parking is $16/night. Another negative in my opinion. The room left a lot to be desired. There was an obvious, crusty, dark stain on the carpet, right in the middle of the room that was apparently not touched. Disgusting. All of the furniture has glass tops and they looked dusty. The bathroom furniture and fixing were all dented, nicked and just worn. There were stains all over the wall in this room. I didn't stay for breakfast. The internet worked fine. Overall huge disappointment and not up to Hilton standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: CaptChaitanya
Reviews.Content: Hilton Honors Gold Member. Had to stay at this hotel for 6 days. Rooms were okay nothing special to mention. Parking is a big hassle especially when it rains as you would have no option but to walk in the rain. The parking charges is pretty steep at 30 dollars a night. The staff were not too concerned about guest satisfaction. Nothing great to write about food either. Stay here only if you have to or if on a short transit. Location is pretty accessible to Fashion Valley Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Place”
Reviews.Author: EricLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Convenient and recently updated. An ok place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do you like filthy stained sheets and old mattresses?”
Reviews.Author: comfortablyclean
Reviews.Content: Me neither! How about a balcony with bird poop all over the sides of the glass? Old saggy mattresses and paper thin walls so you can hear everyword on the phone call the guy next door or in the hall? The clincher? Filthy stained up sheets --one of them look like someone sat down without their underwear on---gag! Oh yeah, don't expect to get help from the manager when you ask to move to another hotel. She will stomp around like a teenager whose been asked to clean her room. Yikes, the unprofessional attitude was not pleasant. And if you actually want to stay in a clean hotel, be prepared to pay. The Doubletree Club will not take responsibility to help you out with the last Hilton hotel left in the city. We paid an EXTRA 130.00 a night to change just to have a clean room with reasonably updated ammenaties. Nasically this is a run down hotel that is trying to hold it together on the outside. It is not near anything if you don't have a car. A bit of worrisome surroundings in term of safety. The guys at the breakfast buffet were kind and fun. A sad story where only the cookies are good.

Reviews.Title: “Sure not up to Doubletree Standards”
Reviews.Author: wndsong
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. So glad it wasn't longer. I was greeted with a warm cookie, but other than that it was hard to tell that this was a Doubletree. Sure doesn't meet Hilton Standards. The lobby is old and outdated. The person that waited on us didn't bother to give any gold member amenities or upgrade the room. She was inexperienced and unhelpful. After getting to the room, it was a disappointing view looking through a dirty window. The bed was comfortable. The heating system was noisy and totally outdated. The towels were the quality of a Motel 6. The sink in the bathroom looked like it was made for a travel trailer. Breakfast was okay. Certainly nothing to write home about. If at all possible, I will not be staying in this hotel for future travels. Hilton needs to take a look at this property and perhaps change the name to San Diego Economy Type Hotel. Would not even meet Hampton Inn standards

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: jim a
Reviews.Content: Negatives The lobby smells like a casino from the smokers sitting right out side the lobby. Our room smelled so bad with sewer they had to move us. Parking is $16 a night. The hotel ran out of hot water one morning. Maids tends to throw everything away ( even good stuff). The 2 police cars came several times ( I'm not sure what that was all about). Positives: warm cookies, nice heated pool and spa,nice room, nicely decorated room. Hotel was fairly quite. Overall fairly nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, some disconnects”
Reviews.Author: KozyKritter
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent six nights at the Doubletree Club Hotel, and overall it was a good experience. On the plus side, the hotel had a nice contemporary design that carried through to the rooms. For the most part, everything felt new or new-ish. The staff was helpful when approached with a request, and the business center allows you to email items to be printed out for free. On the not so plus side, the refrigerator wouldn't get below 50 degrees and we had to get another trucked upstairs and installed so our food wouldn't spoil. According to a staff member, this happens all the time. Also, the leather(?) on the loveseat's arms was completely worn off on one corner in our room, exposing the dirty interior. We also didn't appreciate the giant fan-fueled air freshener in the lobby hidden behind the ATM machine. It blasted our face full of overpowering fragrance every time we approached the elevators in the lobby. One thing of particular concern was that the building fire alarm went on and off several times one night starting at 2am in the morning, blasting us out of our beds. We tried calling the front desk several times after it began and nobody answered the phone, even after 25 or 30 rings. We finally decided to risk going back to sleep despite not knowing what was going on. Thanks to fellow Trip Advisors, we avoided the $16 parking charge each night by parking on the street a short distance away. We booked this room at half price and I would stay again at that rate but not sure I'd pay the normal rate for what you get in return.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: myagirl0622
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the location and the family suites. This was a family vacation with 4 adults and 4 children. The rooms were ok, nothing special. There was a strong smell of sewage in the hallway. Our floors were never cleaned in the 4 days we were there. Makes you wonder what else isn't being done? The first day our coffeemaker didn't work properly and overflowed so I called room service to get some coffee sent up. The bill for this was $18.86 for 2 cups of coffee....are you kidding me...When I questioned this at the front desk i was told that there was free coffee in the lobby that I could have had instead..........Great if someone had actually told us that at check-in. Parking was another issue. Very tight spaces and $16 a night. We will stay somewhere else the next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs cleaning/repairs.”
Reviews.Author: 35Lynn35
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on it's location and that they have family suites with a separate bedroom for the kids with bunk beds. The location was great in that it was within close driving distance to pretty much anywhere in SD we wanted to go. However, there isn't a lot within walking distance. We had a rental car so that was fine. Parking is a little expensive, but at least they don't charge for internet. Staff seemed pleasant. The breakfast buffet was $$$ so we never even tried it. The pool area and lobby were very nice, appeared to be updated not too long ago. However...let's be real about the rooms. I can't believe the reviews stating "it was the cleanest hotel I've ever been to"!! This was our only issue with the hotel, but it is a big one! Upon arrival there were chip crumbs on the floor, hair in the bathroom, and even hair stuck to the wall in the bathroom-the walls looked like they're never washed down or repainted...ever. Almost every light on the ceiling was not securely attached to the ceiling, and the outlet in the kids room was only halfway attached to the wall...not exactly safe for a little kids bedroom. Also, the queen beds were Extremely soft, like to the point of being uncomfortable. Didn't bother my husband, but gave me back/neck pain. The twin beds for the kids were good though. All in all it wasn't bad enough that I would leave the hotel since we really enjoyed having that separate area for the kids, however until some repairs and additional cleaning was done to the rooms..we wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Damian C
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and staff, everyone was very friendly, Good location for all the surrounding tourist attractions. Nice size room.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Stay”
Reviews.Author: Diane B
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Doubletree when San Diego had a citywide power outage and was trapped in the elevator. Even though I called my friend immediately, the hotel did not come looking for me for over a half hour. I spent 5 and 1/2 hours in the elevator. I finally got out after my sister-in-law showed up and took control. She got the number of the elevator company and told them to call. The company came in less then 30 minutes and got me out. The hotel claims they called right away but I checked with the elevator company and they only have a record of the hotel calling after I had been in the elevator 5 hours. My friend stayed outside the elevator and ran down 8 flights of steps every half hour (in the dark) to check on waht was happening. The hotel couldn't be bothered to send someone up to update us. After I got out the hotel said they would bring me food. It was a bag with 2 bottles of water, a bad apple, dried up orange, banana, chips and dried cranberries. The next day no one from the hotel contacted me to see how I was doing. When I told the front desk I wanted to file a report they said I had to do it online and that they were told noone was stuck in the elevator. I left two messages and filed a complaint on Hiton's site, no response. Guest Services is there to protect the hotel not help the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but night manager could use some help”
Reviews.Author: gigidev
Reviews.Content: Before I start, I have to say that during my stay at the DoubleTree (1515 hotel circle south, Oct 2011) I was on East coast time. Whenever possible, I stay at Hilton properties... for my meeting at the University of San Diego, the Doubletree seemed to meet my needs. They are not shy to brag about their service... just ask, blah, blah blah. Well, due to TSA regs, I never pack toothpaste, but always get it from the hotel. I called for it my first morning there and was told it would be sent up. 40 minutes later, I went down to the desk to ask to them to call a cab... and to retrieve my toothpaste. I was told... oops... we only have one packet left. Dinner that night was room service. soup and salad. I asked for bread and was actually charged for cold toast. ugh. Next morning @ 7am, i needed more toothpaste and while that did arrive, I had to call downstairs for a cab. The one young man working (seemed to be alone) and said he would be happy to call a cab. I went downstairs and waited. He was running around like crazy. Also, he was dressed in very casual pants and a polo... not what I expect from a front desk person.He really appeared to be overworked and needed help. I guess the next shift doesnt come on until after 7? Overall adequate hotel. nothing special... but fine. I would stay here again, but would probably spring for the Hilton Hotel if I could. Fast forward to day two...

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel for business, pick something else for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: cmj0502
Reviews.Content: This hotel was average. The rooms were clean and offered the basics. I was on the 5th floor and the smell in the hallway and by the elevators was disgusting. It smelled like sewer. Luckily this smell was not in the rooms. My shower had a faulty drain and I stood in water each time I showered. Overall it was a decent hotel and the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: jaypee28
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree Club in San Diego. Location is great, only a 10-15 minute drive to downtown, shopping and the beaches. A group of us stayed here end of August 2011. We got 3 rooms, and they were able to put our rooms next to each other. Check in was quick and easy. They also give you free cookies when you check in. The hotel concierge even helped us find a limo/shuttle to downtown. Valet is not free for hotel guests, but it is cheaper than most of the hotel valets if you stay in Gaslamp. Our only complain is the toilet in one of the rooms was broken. My friends staying in the room called the front desk to have it fixed. But the same day it was suppostedly fixed, it broke again. My friends asked for a different room, but they would have been moved to a completely different floor. So they decided to just deal with the broken toilet. It was more of an inconvenience than anything else, and the manager waived the valet parking fees for all 3 rooms to compensate for the trouble. Overall a great hotel, for the price and location. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: hrg24
Reviews.Content: Check in went very smooth, and took less than 3 min. The service at the hotel is not fantastic, but it is okay, and I got no complaints. The rooms were spacious, clean and modern. We stayed 3 people in a 2 queen bed room, and we had plenty of space. Beds were comfy, and the bathroom was also very nice. For a 3 star hotel the rooms are excellent. Didn't use the pool, but the pool area was nice and clean. Hotel offers free wireless internet. Parking cost $16 per night. Location is great if you have a car, and don't want to spend too much money on accom, however, I will stay in a different area next time. Downtown is a very nice area, but hotels are way more expensive, but def, the best option if you don't have a car. Pacific Beach is a great place for going out, and is a very chill area. Overall, it is a very nice and modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL,LOVED IT, WILL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: becky l
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cleanest, greatest hotels I have ever stayed at. The staff was great. I cant say enough about how nice the room was. We had the room with an added room with bunk beds. Food was good at the restaraunt and the pool was warm and wonderful. The only thing I would suggest is lower price for parking..

Reviews.Title: “Predictable Hilton Quality”
Reviews.Author: SingleTraveler98
Reviews.Content: I stayed here September 1-4 while attending a conference in San Diego. I found the location convenient with freeway access to the zoo and other parts of the city I wanted to see. I'm one of those people who stays at chain hotels because most hotels in the chain have predictable standards. That was true of the DoubleTree Club. It was clean, staff was efficient, and rooms contained amenities one expects from a DoubleTree. Wireless Internet was FREE but that was made up by the $16 per day parking fee. The breakfast buffet was bountiful and tasty. The staff was accommodating. My room had a door connecting to the next room, something I usually try to avoid due to noise. I had two nights of peace. The third night a family with children was next door doing what children do, and the sounds came through the door. I learned long ago to bring ear plugs along, and I needed them that night. The rate I paid was reasonable for the area, and breakfast was free with my Hilton Hhonors membership. I will probably return to this hotel next time I come to San Diego for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: SimenFL
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at this hotel for one week with one of my friends as our temporary adress while searching for a apartment i San Diego. The Hotel itself is next to a highway which is quite noisy if you are outdoors, but we where not bothered with any noise in our room since the room was good isolated from the noise. Room was cleaned every day and the bed quite comfortable. The wifi could be faster and more stable. When connecting to foreign websites the connection feels really slow (we are living in Northern Europe). The Gym is quite small, and with only one bench which can be used to train with dumbbells and only two tread mills. Receptionists were service minded and helped us with all our inquires. For the price we payed for 1 week the hotel has great value! We are very pleased with our stay, would recommend this hotel if you don´t need to be living nearby everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, BUT....”
Reviews.Author: claudiopuyssegur
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree hotel circle was nice but the restaurant in the hotel is overpriced and bland. The pool was very nice but crowded. The rooms were very nice, good pillows, good mattresses, nice coffee, and TV..no complaints. AVOID rooms 805, 806 and 807 on the 8th floor because the air conditioning system is on the roof right above these rooms..YOU WILL NOT GET ANY SLEEP. The only real complaint i have is DO YOU REALLY NEED TO HAVE MUSIC PLAYING ALL THE TIME! IN THE POOL, IN THE LOBBY OUTSIDE! When I go on vacation I WANT PEACE AND QUIET! PLEASE GET RID OF THE MUSIC 24/7! Overall I would give this hotel 7 out of 10. I'm not sure if I would there stay again because no matter which room you are in YOU WILL HEAR THE FREEWAY TRAFFIC.

Reviews.Title: “a good stay”
Reviews.Author: smithNewZealand
Reviews.Content: we are from new zealand, reading the reviews had me very worriied about my choices in staying in hotels for our three week stay in the usa we had four days in doubletree club hotel san diego, well on arriving we found the hotel to be very nice the rooms very big we were staying with our two teenaged sons, the beds big and so comfortble lots of pillows big flat screen tv, cookies on arrival, good size bath room with bath nice views from our room, a couch and table with chair for our laptop. the pool and hot tub we used every day it was so good and there gym was good to we had tea at the resturant one night really good pizza over all our whole family loved staying here and would come back again, some times its good to read trip adviser but some people are really so picky for them they should pay more stay at really flash places and stop moaning over all i would give this an 8 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Family oriented”
Reviews.Author: WallyFletcher84PA
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here. The housekeeping staff were great and the front desk personnel pleasant. Everything is professional and clean. I was a bit miffed at the $16 a day parking though.

Reviews.Title: “More for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: sahuaritaMom
Reviews.Content: Grounds are very well kept and hotel is very clean. While we were there, there was some sort of convention going on and the hotel was more geared toward the business crowd. Employees at front desk were professional, but icey. I didnt feel welcomed at all. You are given a warm cookie upon check in and their literature says you can ask for another cookie during your stay. When I asked for another cookie one of the girls went to get it and the other told her there wasnt enough for me to have one. Very awkward! There was a problem with the bath tub draining, which was repaired as soon as I reported it. We rented a family suite for a week. We were told there were no laundry facilities either, which wasnt good news to me being that we had been to the beach a few times. The room was wonderful though. The food on site is very overpriced. There are no free breakfast or any kind of inexpensive meals. There were also flyers from local places to eat each day under my door, which made me wonder why they would let people in the hotel to pass out flyers daily. I stay at HIlton hotels as I know they have expectations that have to be met. Homewood suites is much more family oriented. No microwave in the room, which isnt good when you want to heat up left overs from the places that you have eaten at.

Reviews.Title: “Family Suite - Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Penni77
Reviews.Content: We planned a family get away to San Diego and searched for a family friendly hotel that would accomodate 5. The Family Suite at the Doubletree in San Diego looked great, however it was a total misrepresentation to what we actually stayed in! The suite only slept 4 and one of my kids had to sleep on the floor. I was extremely dissappointed upon check in and called the front desk. No managers were on staff (at 6:00 on a Friday night) and the front desk staff were not able to do anything other than comp us a movie and bring extra bedding. I was not able to actually talk to a person in charge until the following evening. Our room was at the end of the hall, next to the ice machine. The bathroom was dirty. The package that we selected came with a movie, popcorn, cookies and a pizza. The popcorn was microwave, which is fine, but we had no microwave in the room. Needless to say I was more than happy to leave this horrible hotel. I will never stay there again. It felt like the old broken down hotel where the hand me downs go to.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay except for not so good sofabed”
Reviews.Author: JSAontheroad
Reviews.Content: If not for the sofa bed scenario, I would say this hotel is very, very good. But my sofabed experience left me sleepless and aching the next day. When I made reservations, I was happy to know that every room has a sofa bed. All the other “amenities:, such as cleanliness, free wi-fi, 24-hr small convenience store, warm cookies (!), refrigerator, etc. – were great. From July 20-24, I shared a 2-Queen beds room with two other senior ladies. We planned to switch off sleeping on the sofa bed, since sofa beds are generally not as comfortable as actual beds. The Queen size beds were very comfortable with the fluffy pillows, as well. The sofa bed, however, needs to have a new mattress, or total replacement. Unfortunately, I took the sofa bed the first night. When I opened up the sofabed, I felt the mattress – and at first thought it was upside down. I felt a mesh of large metal bars, which was either the springs or overall metal construction underneath the mattress. I took the extra blankets from the closet and doubled them up on top of the mattress. I should have called the front desk immediately, but so tired after a 4-hour drive, I fell asleep – but woke up at 3 am, distressed and in severe discomfort. Early in the morning I went to the front desk, described the situation, and asked if they could bring up two or more padded mattress covers, which I could double up on top of the mattress. The gal there apologized, and was very accommodating. When my friends and I returned in the evening from the Convention Center, the sofa bed was re-made, with 3 doubled-up padded mattresses. Still a little saggy, but much improved.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and awesome beds!!”
Reviews.Author: dsnymommy
Reviews.Content: Stood for one night on July 15th. Even though the parking garage is not attached to the building we still had a nice stay, so if you book this hotel just remember when you park in front have someone in your party grab a luggage cart while someone else does the check-in and start unloading your stuff, we were lucky and had a room on the first floor:) The customer service was nice and the nice warm cookies were yummy! After we put our stuff in the room we were all exhausted from our day at Sea World so we decided to eat at the restaurant in the hotel, the waiter was a little slow but realizing his hands shook a lot and he was older we overlooked how long he took, he was a older man trying to make a living and obviously with a disease that effected his nervous system and since I have MS I give him props!! Now the food was GREAT! We all had cheeseburgers and my daughter had gnocchi and a salad all the food was hot nice portions and for five people including beer was $75 which to me was fine since it was ten at night and we were all to tired to drive around looking for food. After dinner we showered and slept in some VERY COMFY beds:) Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: weluvtrvln
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel while visiting San Diego Zoo. We loved this hotel and found it to be great for families. We loved opening the door to the balcony allowing for some fresh air to come in. The beds were comfortable and there were extra pillows and blankets in the closest(not sure if they were supposed to be there). We stayed in the room with 2 queen beds and the sofa had a pull out twin bed, perfect for additional bedding, although it the hotel is not supposed to fit more than four individuals in the room. This hotel books fast so book early. As always, the cookies are delicious!

Reviews.Title: “terrible. Buyer beware, don't waste your money here!!”
Reviews.Author: kmab310
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some "less than great" hotels in my life, but this place takes the cake!! My husband and I stayed here for 10 days because I had to attend a conference downtown. In a nutshell, here were our problems: 1). Broken fridge for the entire stay (was replaced eventually... with a equally broken refridgerator!! I wouldn't have been so mad if we hadn't bought a bunch of perishables for the week that we had to throw out). The second time we called, the maintenance guy told us he'd be right back... and never came back. The third time (after 4 hours), the guy told us he'd look for a new fridge... Never came back. The fourth time the desk said they'd send someone up, but they never did. 2) On our last day, we woke up to NO WATER!! We couldn't brush our teeth, shower, or use the bathroom..... When we tried to call to find out what was the problem, nobody ever answered. We'd had so many problems thus far, we decided to just forgo the shower and get the heck out. At checkout, no appologies were made, no explanations were given... and absolutely no discount offered. Really?? The hotel charges $160/night and they don't feel it necessary to provide running water? Seriously... DON'T stay here. Other issues: the staff was less than friendly the entire week. At check in, they asked for a credit card and I gave them one, asking why they needed it since the room was paid in full in advance. I specifically asked whether they intended to charge a deposit, and I was told NO. Well, the next morning I discovered $350.00 had been charged to my creditcard. The front desk admitted it was their mistake and told me.... "Sorry about that, the girl who told you that is new. Unfortunately, there's nothing we can do to get you your money back, and if you check out early you'll lose the $ you pre-paid for the room. If you had brought a car with you, I'd offer you free parking." Well that helps now doesn't it. Half my spending money is now unavailable to me, but I get to park my imaginary car for free!!! I wouldn't have been upset to put a deposit down, that's pretty common. I was mad because the girl lied to my face. Furthermore, it was not mentioned anytime.... I went back through the fine print (priceline, etc) and I was never told that I would need to put a deposit down. Still would have been okay if the girl hadn't lied to me and then refused to do anything about it. As for the rest of the stuff: the cookies were cold (I've seen a lot of people ask about that... it was the least of my concern but they do boast "warm"); the hot tub was not hot and the pool seemed nice, but we didn't jump in because the weather was rainy/overcast. The resteraunt staff were equally as rude, and the breakfast buffet consisted of runny scrambled eggs, soggy potatoes and pancakes, cold coffee, and assorted breads and yogurt. Not exactly worth the $15.00 they'll charge you for it. We ordered pizza once (up to our room), It cost us $20 and arrived cold. I wish we would have called Domino's or something. I thought it was super gross and wouldn't recommend that, either. We tried to hit up the happy hour, and the waitress who greeted us had no idea what was on the happy hour specials... Nice. When we finally did figure it out, the food we had (chicken wings and flautas) was pretty good! cleanliness: Actually, it was decently Clean! For the most part, anyway. Wouldn't rave about it, but it wasn't scary to sleep in the beds and I never saw any bugs. Considering the rest of our trip, I'd say the cleanliness was the highlight of our stay. The cleaning crew came almost every day... They'd empty the trash, make the beds and wipe off the counters. They didn't replace our sheets ever, and didn't replace our drinking cups when they "cleaned". We had to call down to get extra toilet paper and soap when we ran out, which took forever because of the front desk's wonderful service. At least the water was still working at that point. Needless to say, please take heed and consider my mistake before you book! I had read a few bad reviews about this place before I booked it, and I wish I would have listened. Locatation: On a side note it was very difficult to access downtown from this hotel's location. Their is a bus system that can get you there if you're willing to take several hours and buy multiple transfer or all day passes, but it isn't at all convenient. I didn't feel safe taking it at night, although I've lived in big cities such as D.C. and Miami. Taxis will cost you $20.00 each way, unless they take the round about ways as did our first driver. There is hardly anything but other hotels within walking distance. Hope this is useful!

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Experience...”
Reviews.Author: OliviaJWright
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 5 hours early, and asked if our room was vacant, but it wasn't, which was not their fault. Anyway, they gladly tagged and held our luggage for us while we sat by the beautiful fire pit and pool. When our room was ready, it was very nice- great beds and accomodations. We had only 2 problems there- there was an older woman in the jacuzzi, wearing undergarments, which we informed the hotel of, but they never took action. The second was really not in the hotel's control- there were two VERY rude British teens, who were splashing us on purpose and mocking us. Otherwise, it was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good, bad and ugly”
Reviews.Author: avttravel
Reviews.Content: Good: Upon complaining about the smelly room the check-in clerk promptly gave us another room. The lobby was decorated well. The breakfast buffet had many choices. The location is convenient for SeaWorld and Old Town San Diego. Bad: There was no bellhop. So we had to carry all of our luggage for check-in and check-out. The room that they gave us first time smelled really bad. My dad was nauseated and almost threw up because of the smell. There were no coffee creamers, we had to ask for them. We had to ask for coffee creamers every day during our stay. The parking lot was very tight. It was tough to turn our minivan. Ugly: The room was dirty. It had cheerios and safety pins on the floor. The coffee machine had provision for brewing two cups at a time. But one side was broken so we could only brew one cup at a time. The reading light was missing from one of the beds. There was a big hole in its place. One of the blanket had holes (looked worn) and a big cut (looked as if somebody cut it with a pair of scissors). The worst thing is that though we complained about the service at the front desk every day during our stay, there was no improvement during our entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeepers don't clean, just vacuum and make beds”
Reviews.Author: LisaReedFamily
Reviews.Content: I found the same problems that I read on the reviews; dirty cups that I know for a fact the housekeeper replaced the paper lid on to make it look as though it had been replaced, sink not cleaned (just wiped in the front with water and soap still lingering behind the faucet), family suite has a big red stain on the carpet (room 501), can hear the elevator all day (though this didn't bother me at night as the elevator use really slowed down), and the towels were not replaced. This is the second night of a seven night stay. I read the reviews before booking so I knew what I was getting into. The lack of hygienic practices by the housekeepers is disappointing, but I am just making sure to bring in plastic cups and ask for towels at the front desk. The only reason I went ahead with the booking was due to the family suite and a decent rate. The evening front desk staff on 6/5 were really nice and the pool and lobby is very attractive as well. If you don't need a family suite, I would recommend staying elsewhere as who knows if the sheets get changed or the towels just refolded instead of replaced by what seems to be a housekeeping staff that cuts corners. I hope the manager doesn't just write one of his generic "sorry we didn't meet your expectations" replies but that he actually states that they are going to audit rooms periodically to evaluate my concerns. If the housekeeping really cleaned, this would be a great hotel. The towels are fluffy, the bedding nice (not plush but still nice), and the family suite is great. The red stain and elevator noise did not bother me as they were negligible distractions.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good overall! Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: niamhie11
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked the Hilton San Diego for 10 nights and were hit with the collapse of 1800 hotels, losing our booking and cash. Unwilling to pay an additional 1700 euro, we settled for the cheaper option. When we first arrived we were given our cookies by the friendly front desk staff and given our room key. The room was nice enough but had a thin locked door separating our room from a noisy family room. Not willing to put up with this on our relaxing holiday, we asked the front desk to move us. They were very understanding and arranged for our bags to be moved while we went to the pool. This area was nice with a hot tub and little fire pit. Spent a couple of lazy days here. There are some restaurants around the block including a tgi's and a little Mexican place next door which looks bad from outside but serves lovely food and great cocktails quite cheaply. Food in the doubletree was quiet nice, decent choice if a little more pricey. Dinner was pretty good, no complaints. All in all we would definitely recommend. If you're the type of person who likes to analyse the paintwork/ceiling cracks in a hotel I would suggest you avoid and; 1. Stump up the cash for a proper Hilton. 2 Get a life, you're on holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Yes im ticked about their happy hour.”
Reviews.Author: Ksupaul
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't that bad but the happy hour absolutely sucks. it's advertised everywhere about low prices on happy hour drinks but they don't honor it. Holidays dont count but it says that no where. You order a white wine and they give you an $8 glass because you didn't ask for the cheap stuff. And thier beer isnt half price on anything but one variety and that is never mentioned. Barkeep blames it all on the manager as his ipod ear piece is in his ears while he waits on customers. Hotel is fine but stay away of bar and resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Okay in most ways”
Reviews.Author: Amador
Reviews.Content: First the plus side: The location is okay, not too far from Old Town. The public spaces (lobby, grille, pool) and spacious and attractive, perfect for family gatherings. The room (620) was attractive and comfortable, but for the black mildew stain on the bathroom ceiling. Then the minus side: When you get out of your car at the front door, your first impression is of the loud, blaring "music" which makes speaking (much less thinking) nearly impossible. The blaring "music" at the elevators in the lobby is nearly as bad. The food in the Panini Grill and Bar is pretty good, but the service in the Grill is pathetic. For example, on our first evening, I dined with my wife and our four-year-old granddaughter. When we sat, we were asked if we wanted anything to drink. I ordered a glass of water for my wife, a Coke with a lid and straw for granddaughter and a scotch whiskey (neat) for myself. My wife was served water (so far, so good), granddaughter was served water in a glass with lid and straw and I was served Coke (neat). When I laughed and pointed out that the Coke was not scotch, the waiter insisted that it was. Those booking a family suite beware: There are five per floor, two at each end of the corridor (very quiet) and one sharing a wall with the three elevators (very noisy). Parking is $16/day.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recomand this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cyberallen
Reviews.Content: hotel is off of noisy freeway, blocked by other low graded motels, no view what so ever! no beds were made, or it was done late at our request! swimming pool is small. water drain problem inside the bath tub that is cracked, looks like more than 20years old tub. not too sanitary for my family. if you are paying this much for hotel you expect better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Coast to coast flight, and then greeted by incompetence.”
Reviews.Author: TravelerNJ201
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors Gold member. I have stayed in many Doubletrees, and, until now, always been pleased. We just arrived after a long flight from the east coast, knowing we might arrive after the restaurant was closed, we used the feature of the Hilton honors web page that allows you to order food and beverages ahead of time to bewaiting in the room. Tired and hungry, we arrived in our room (no honors upgrase, by the way) to find nothing waiting. A call to the front desk first resulted in a denial that there was any record of my order. When I returned to the lobby to discuss it, they admitted they had the order in the system. They then told me the restaurant was closed, so they could do nothing for me, except offer to sell me the food tomorrow, which, of course, is of no help whatsoever. So, we'll be going to bed without dinner, and never returning to this Doubletree again. If you are accustomed to any kind of decent service, go somewhere else. Ps, I am also a HGVC owner.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but high rate”
Reviews.Author: lovetofly4
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviews. You can hear through the connecting doors like its a curtain hung between the two rooms. This was true from Room 401, a family suite with 2 queen beds and one bunk bed we booked for $159/night. Pros Free wireless internet was great. The pool was heated and clean. We enjoyed it with our toddler. There is a firepit in the pool area where we had wine and enjoyed the night sky. The restaurant has decent food and the bar has a happy hour from 5-7p weeknight evenings with drink and appetizer specials. Hotel was in a good location - easy drive to downtown and seaworld and the beaches. I loved the idea of a family suite which is the main reason I booked this hotel. There was some extra space for our toddler to run around and play, and she loved sitting at the kids table for drawing and snacks. But moving on to the cons, its not really a full 2 room suite. Cons Family Suite = Kid-used = was showing wear. We had the prior mentioned red stained carpet in our room. It looks like red markers or paints from youngsters’ art attempts. The bathroom door had scratches and the frame was busted around the door. There were stains on the curtains in the kids room. There were engravings on the bunk bed. The floor in the room was slanted in the middle. Therefore, the door that separated the rooms did not reach the ground. The chest of drawers in the kids room with the flat screen tv on top was tilting because of the floor slant. It looked unsafe for the toddler. Stay away from room 401 due to these reasons. There was half a cookie left from the prior guests pushed under the dust ruffle of the bed. Poor attention to cleaning. The parking garage is definitely a nightmare. We parked to the left of the structure - you can drive up the hill on the left of the structure and avoid the garage. For the amount we spent in the hotel on parking, drinks, room service, movie, I felt it was not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and comfort for a good price”
Reviews.Author: mariagarsa
Reviews.Content: I love the small hotel and I loved the rooms. Our bed and linens were couzy and we got Neutrogena products daily. The pool and jacuzzi area are nice, the breakfast owesome, full of delicious fruits, yoghurts, ham, dausaces and more. The days we were there there were tons of families with sccer player kids yet the environment felt very quiet and relxed. I would stay again! We went with our 2 years old daughter perfect for her! Free computers and printing and free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but not great either.”
Reviews.Author: crews95
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the family suite ammenity with two rooms, one of which has bunk beds and children's furniture. That part was fine, but the balcony was off of that room. What poor planning on someone's part. My husband and I would want to sit on the balcony after putting the kids to bed but would have to wait till we knew they were asleep before sneaking through the room. The TV in the kids room didn't work properly. The bathtub faucet shot off the wall when my husband was in the shower. All these issues were dealt with promptly and courteously. This hotel was more than $200/night during off season. I did not think it was worth the money at this time of year much less during peak season. I would have preferred spending a little more to upgrade the accomodations. It is situated right off the freeway, I should have guessed the traffic noise would be loud but didn't think of this. All hours of day or night there was traffic noise. However, it was conveniently located to downtown, Old Town, Seaport Village, Sea World and the Zoo. Took minutes to get anywhere. There was just a kind of "cheap" vibe to the rooms. Nothing really in disaray yet nothing completely perfect. I felt a muggy, dirty quality. The pool was heated and nice and clean pool area. When checking in, we reciceved a "goody" bag with popcorn, cookies, candies and free pay per view movie and a coupon for a free pizza and Coke from the hotel restaraunt. We were told we could use this coupon "in the restaraunt" but when we went to use it, they gave us a hassle saying it was only for "takeout". They ended up giving it to us to eat there but not after debating the issue, The pizza was more like glorified frozen pizza than anything else. The restaraunt was tiny, extremely overpriced, the food was mediocre and we never ate there for the rest of our stay. The staff was very friendly, knowledgable and helpful. But we probably will not stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you can get a discounted rate”
Reviews.Author: scoochAlberta
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was the Family King Suite (non bunk bed version on the 8th floor) First the pro's: The location is very central and the rooms were as shown in the pictures. Very modern and nice. (It is right off the freeway - we asked for a room at the back and we were accomodated. Our room was quiet - no complaints at all.) The room was quite clean; however, see below for one note about that. The pool area was very clean and the pool was heated. The room had a door between our room and the office/livingroom space so we could put our son to bed and still watch tv in our room. It was nice that he could be to sleep at a normal time and we could stay up later. Due to the length of our stay, the hotel waived our $16 a night parking fee. (My husband requested it prior to booking the room. They did try to charge us for it at check out, but it was an oversight - as soon as we told them that there was a note on our file that our fee was to be waived, they took it off and didn't charge us and were apologetic. They seemed genuine.) The staff were friendly. We found the bed very comfy - we like beds on the firmer side. The pillows are fluffy, but we would've liked them to be longer. At least there were plenty of them and we quickly got more pillows and blankets when we called the desk. (See note in the cons re: more...) The cons: Not too impressed with the sofa bed. The cushion on the couch had a broken zipper and the stuffing was falling out the back. The mattress on it was terrible - not good for an adult at all. As previously noted, in another person's review, we also smelled cigarette smoke during our stay. Only for one night but the smell was very bad. I did observe the cleaning staff cleaning our glasses in the bathroom sink. We used paper cups after that. In our opinion, they should be put through a dishwasher and sanitization process. Not the hotel's fault necessarily, but there were several sports teams staying for the weekend. We obviously had no access to the pool area during their stay. As well, the kids were playing some form of ball in the walk way to the door - not very safe for people trying to get by. Perhaps the hotel staff could try to curb the ball games, at the very least? The cushions on the patio furniture near the fire pit area at the pool need replacing. Some are torn and very worn. They are not up to the standard of the hotel. Some of the spare blankets we received were VERY worn, even with holes. They need to check them before providing to guests. Our biggest disappointment was that we read on their website that laundry facilities were onsite so we packed light. There were not facilities onsite - major disappointment when we were there for 8 nights. We were told we could perhaps go to a sister hotel, but they didn't make arrangements for us, nor could they tell us if we could use their pool or anything while we waited for the laundry to be done. Ultimately, we had to make our own arrangements. There is no microwave and the fridge was quite small. Overall, though we found many pluses to the hotel, we most likely won't stay again due to the smoking, lack of laundry facilities and their cleaning of glasses in our bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely nice Hotel with superb rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chemicalx81
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is within 15mins from the Airport and in a nice spot. During Check-in you're recognizes as a HHonors Status Customer and get mostlikely a upgrade for free. The Room was very nice with a balcony and nice view! The Pool Area was also nice, with a Hot Tub and Pool and a Fireplace. Staff was very friendly. Parking was for free as a HHonors Status Customer The only CON during this stay was, the some of the Breakfast Bagels had mold on... Luckily we saw this befor eating them. Otherwise the Breakfast Buffet was ok, nothing special. For HHonors Status Customer is the Breakfast for free. Parking Garage is nothing for broad cars as the way up or down is very very very small.

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel, could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyJR
Reviews.Content: Stay at hotel for a week in July 2010. It's a great kid hotel, maybe a little too good -- the hotel was always PACKED with screaming kids while staying. (Seemed like popular choice for kids athletic events -- lots of soccer, volleyball teams, etc staying there -- kids extremely poor mannered and little supervision.) So hotel lobby, pool (very small, but outdoor) and parking were crazy. Rooms were nice, but needed updating. Our carpet was stained with some type of crusty red dye in both rooms -- our room was a 'kid suite.' (Oversized hotel room with a wall in the middle -- king bed/TV on one side and sofa bed and desk in 'other room.') Great concept for some privacy for parents, but just a little out-of-date. Restaurant not good -- at dinner there once and it very OVER priced and food very basic. Breakfast buffet (free for us) was OK, but by the end of the week were all very sick of it -- always buffet scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, toast, cereal, and pastries. (Food standard 'banquet' or free food type. Hotel NOT close to other restaurants -- no great restaurants right near by, always had to drive -- must have a car to stay here. (We're headed back to San Diego in March and have chosen a Hilton downtown, not sure if it will be better or not.) Management/staff not good -- asked to have manager call us when checked in -- never received call. Talked to front desk about some problems -- they less than cared. This hotel is overflowing because of the kids that stay, it's not because of the staff, cleanliness, food or atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Doubletree Club”
Reviews.Author: vonroo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree Club in Januart '11. the hotel was very comfortable with free WiFi connection, coffee maker and fridge in the room plus air con and tv. The rooms were kept to a very high standard with good quality towel replacement as required. Room service was also available if needed. The staff were extreemely friendly and helpful. Outside there is also a lovely heated outdoor pool area with comfortable sun loungers and seating. The hotel provides towels for the pool area and requests patrons not to remove them brom the bedrooms.There is also a gym and wellness centre (which I did'nt use). It is situated not far from the centre of Old Town and is only a €20 taxi fare from the Airport. The only negative was breakefast was a bit expensive at €12.95+tax. However it was buffet style and offered a good choice .

Reviews.Title: “Lacking friendliness associated with Doubletee”
Reviews.Author: Bearhunternm
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasnt hard to find, did research on the hotel and liked that area that it was in. Upon check in, there was no greeting from the front desk staff, they didnt even make eye contact, also seemed put out that someone was taking up their time. I had to give them my name since they failed to ask. Wasnt given any information concerning my reservation, such as the dates of my stay nor the rate i was paying, also being a Hilton Honors member they didnt even tell me that my number was on file. I also mentioned that i was going to be paying cash, since sometimes i dont really use my credit card. i was rudely informed that they needed $200.00 not stating why, maybe if i trashed the room or for parking and other resort fees?? Not sure, so i ended up using my credit card. I was given my keys and the complementary cookies. The room was nice and was very clean. Upon check out, the desk staff as rude as the previous shift, i advised them i was going to settle my bill with cash, again they seemed put off. Then i mentioned if they had my Hilton Honors card on file and they said they did, but i gave them the number and they they said that the number they had wasnt the one i was quoting them. I know its not really important to mention that but being that they are part of the Hilton Family and follow this program, its part of the standards and guidelines. I dont think i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spatious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PATHH
Reviews.Content: My room was very spatious, with two comfortable, large beds, clean, fresh and all updated. Hotel was quiet, with nice outdoor heated swimming pool area (weather was a bit chilly for me in Jan). Free wi-fi is fast with a decent-sized desk and office chair, breakfast buffet good at $13. It's c. $16 in a shared ride San Diego airport, and a fairly lengthy mile walk or $8 taxi to the Fashion Valley mall and tram stop. Check in/out fast and convenient with enough staff. Only minor points were no way to lock the balcony door when open a couple of inches (since I prefer fresh air rather than any a/c) and no safe in room, but there was a proper night-chain/device on the main room door (not my hated but increasingly common device that a pass key can open from outside). I had a remarkable deal on flight from UK and 7 nights for less then colleagues paid for the flight. Would certainly stay there again rather than the budget places around it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Jodan29
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a hotel for four adults and a child, I found a suite at this hotel which had two queen beds in one room and bunk beds in the separate adjoining room. Unfortunately, when I booked it, I booked a king bed instead of the queens. The clerk was very helpful, however, and got us two adjoining queen rooms giving us four queen beds, lots of soft feather pillows and very comfortable beds. The only person disappointed was our grandson who was looking forward to sleeping in the bunk beds. The bathrooms were well stocked with lots of towels and amenities, too. The room was clean and gave us enough space although the suite would have been roomier. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant once. Food was okay but pricey. The location is great for getting to the different sites we wanted to see plus the hotel provided us with great maps and directions on how to get there and back which was very helpful. Parking was available at $16 a night which I thought was too high but we always found a space. I thought the staff were very accommodating and friendly. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Customer Service!!! Very miserable location next to the freeway!!”
Reviews.Author: Saso22
Reviews.Content: Very bad Front Desk customer service, very unwelcoming, don't smile and didn't want to look in the notes on his computer from Hotels.com! We had our reservations through hotels.com for 3 adults and 2 teenagers with breakfast. The front desk employee said he can only provide breakfast for 2 guest and 2 children ( which they usually eat free)We had our reservations for 5 through hotel.com which they called and made sure that wrote it on our confirmation and we also confirmed before we went but still the guy didn't want to honor it until we got him our printed reservations with the age of our children which were 14 and16 yrs old. Then he said ok, for our kids but not for my mother in law, she had to pay for her breakfast. We paid $14.00 for breakfast that was very bad, eggs were totally watery and uncooked, also the potatoes were terrible, sausage was bad, coffee and sitting was lousy, waitresses in the first floor were not available only to get the money before we left. Compared to the food we had couple days earlier at another Double Tree Guest and Suites hotel in Anaheim, it was totally different.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry this is not a family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VeJustice
Reviews.Content: If you have small children, I wouldn't recommend this hotel in the least. I love the Hilton and I have used their brand for all of my vacations. I found this hotel to be lacking on so many levels. 1. There is nothing for children to do. Once you return from the parks dead tired with antsy kids there is no game room or area for them to strech their legs. The "tv" viewing room is a joke and consist of two tvs in the lobby. 2. The pool "area" is the size of a single compact car parking space. I dont know how they made it look so big in the pictures but it is not! 3. The hallways had a weird smell that seemed to seep into our pores, its in our clothes which I am washing right now. The flat screens which they boast of were a waste, the tvs were out our whole vacation and the only clear channels we could see were ESPN ESPN2 and FOXNEWS... um no thank you. No disney no nick and a very bored kid at night. The rooms were clean, although the room service kept putting those dirty "sweet dream" pillows on our beds which I promptly removed every night. The area has no resturants, and the one in the hotel is not worth your time or money. I would consider spending an extra hundred and staying someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families!”
Reviews.Author: MrsNelson78
Reviews.Content: My fhusband, 3 kids and I stayed at the Doubletree Club Hotel in San Diego during an early summer vacation and had a fantastic time. We booked our stay with a family package promotion for 2 nights in a family suite that included a free Pay-Per-View movie and pizza. Perfect for the first night in the hotel! Upon arrival we were presented with nice sized goody bag for the kids filled with cookies, other snacks and a few small toys to keep them entertained. A very nice plus. The room was clean, comfortable and nicely decorated and had a seperate room with bunkbeds, television and activity table for the kids. The hotel has a nice pool with a fire pit, but unfortulately it was too cold for us to use on our visit. There is a restaurant where we tried the breakfast buffet which was just okay. There are other restaurants nearby, some in walking distance. There is a Cheesecake Factory less than 5 minutes away by car. The main purpose of our trip was to visit Sea World which was a short drive away. The entire family had enjoyed this hotel and would most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shalom123
Reviews.Content: The warm cookies that you get when you arrive are awesome. The folks at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. My room was comfortable and clean, and so was the bathroom. There was a slightly musty odor in the passage outside my room, but this wasn't a big deal, as I one typically does not spend much time in here. There was no sugar in my room, which was frustrating as I had to go down to the lobby and get it myself (there was nobody available to bring it up)

Reviews.Title: “Was a little apprehensive, but everything was fine!”
Reviews.Author: friedmango
Reviews.Content: After getting this hotel on Priceline, I was a little apprehensive after reading the TripAdvisor reviews on this hotel. It seemed like the last 6-7 reviews blasted the place for one reason or another with apologies from the general manager. The location on Hotel Circle was great. Downtown, Mission Bay, SDSU were only minutes away. My wife and I were pleasantly greeted by a waiting desk clerk, surrounded by a spacious lobby. Often times at Doubletree Hotels it seems like I always forget about the chocolate chip cookies, but the desk clerk handed me three (there was only two of us) right after we received our hotel keys. Our sixth floor room faced the pool and had a nice little balcony. Music in the pool area can be loud, but I just closed the sliding glass door. Our nicely appointed room had a small refrigerator, plasma television, and king size bed. Although the hotel charged $10 for wifi, my wife was able to grab the lobby wifi signal for free from our 6th floor room. Parking was $16, but at least it was in a structure. No complaints here, was very satisfied. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: LC1Oxford
Reviews.Content: Got back from San Diego yesterday and couldn't wait to write my review. This hotel was wonderful. The pool was lovely - we went swimming at either 6.00am or 9.00pm and it was quiet and warm. The fire pit and hot tub are extremely nice - we managed to have both to ourselves on occasions. Towels were always available and the seating area was very pleasant. The pool is not huge, but big enough with a nice section for children. The breakfast buffet was fabulous too. Waffles, pancakes, fresh fruit, croissants, danish pastries, cereal, breakfast potatoes etc. The waiting staff were all friendly and when I needed to get some first aid items the reception staff were very helpful. I was surprised to read the negative comments in other reviews as I couldn't fault the staff I encountered. The room was very nice - comfy beds, a balcony, sofabed, desk and a fridge. I can't think of anything at the hotel that was less than fabulous. I had relatives to pick me up and take me to my destinations so I can't comment on parking or location but the hotel and facilites were great and I am already pining for our room, the pool and the waffles! Absolutely great.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here, not worthy of the Doubletree name!”
Reviews.Author: tigger880
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (2 adults, 3 children under the age of 10) had a summer vacation that was filled with visits to Legoland, Sea World, San Diego Zoo, and Disneyland. While visiting Sea World and the Zoo we stayed at this hotel. The website states they have a Family Suite that are "family-friendly guest suites". Our room was far from it. The separate room where the kids' bunk bed was had a nasty stain on the carpet and the room smelled funky. Also, it was always colder in their room than in our area. The kids wore socks the entire time we were in this room. The entire room in general was not well designed. The area where the two queen beds were was extremely cramped and the bunk bed area had a lot of wasted space. There was VERY LITTLE counter space throughout the entire room and the bathroom was NOT kid friendly. Only the oldest child was able to use the faucet in the bathroom and there was no stool to help the kids reach it. Again, VERY LITTLE counter space in the bathroom; which is HORRIBLE for a family of 5. The "family-friendly" suite we got was on the backside of the elevator. So all night and day we could hear the elevator running. And it was LOUD. Luckily we were tired from the days' events but it was still VERY annoying. The parking situation was bad. The building where the parking lot is and the hotel are not connected. There is a VERY DARK walkway that you walk through to get to the back end of the lobby. There was little to no lighting and my husband did not let any of us walk that portion in the evenings. I was extremely disappointed with this hotel. It is a Doubletree and I expected more from them.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Dreadful!”
Reviews.Author: Coomster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights during a sixteen night California holiday. Despite being one of the most expensive hotels during our trip it was the worst by miles. Although the room has been renovated and was clean it is not the trendy, funky room shown in the website pictures. Nor was the outside pool area which was tiny. Our family room was located next to the lift shaft so we were kept awake by the lifts moving all night long. There is no sound proofing between the rooms or the corridor outside your door so every noise is heard. When you've got a family next door with small children up in the early hours and children running along the corridor it meant no sleep. Infact the two nights we stayed there felt like torture! After spending the day at Seaworld we decided to eat in the hotel restaurant. This is extremely small with a limited menu. It was made worse when we were told the fryer wasn't working. You would be amazed how many things are cooked in the fryer so we ended up with a choice of about three things. The food was awful and we went to bed hungry. The whole restaurant experience was made worse by the waiting staff. They struggle to speak English and shout at you to try and make you understand. It was like something out of a Fawlty Towers sketch when the waiter tried to explain that the fryer had broken! All in all an awful experience. We won't be staying at a Doubletree again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: LeisureTraveler11
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that my family has stayed in a number of Doubltree and Hilton hotels and this one should not be part of that brand. The hotel hallways are dimly lit and have an old smell to them. The rooms have been renovated but that is all that has been done. The outside of the hotel needs a whole gut job. There was peeling paint on the balcony. Another main point that is missing here is laundry facilities. There were many families staying here and it would have been niced to have laundry on the premises. The work out equipment was minimal. After coming from a beautiful Doubletree in Anaheim, the previous week, I can honestly say this hotel did not measure up at all.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunatley there was a strong smell of sewage in our room”
Reviews.Author: ngoc154927
Reviews.Content: Our stay was overall very nice other than every time we came back to the room and opened the door there was an overwhelming smell of sewage. We complained at the front desk and was offered a free movie for one night and an apology. They said the smell was due to some product they were using to clear some pipes and that the smell would not last very long. We stayed there for 4 nights and 5 days and every day and night, the smell was there. I asked the cleaning staff and they advised me that there were a few other rooms that also had this problem. I do not think that it was a product that they were using, I think it was there sewage pipes. The location was good for activities for the kids as it was in between Sea World and the Zoo. We stayed with 2 adults and 3 kids. The location wasn't good for transportation. We did not rent a car so we had to take a cab everywhere. There was no shopping or kid friendly restaurants near by. The kids did enjoy the pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of $16 daily parking.”
Reviews.Author: Rhita
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit of run-down. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. But the staff are terrible. No greeting from the front desk and they were not helpful at all. They charge $16 for daily parking and have a security guy watching cars coming in and out. HOWEVER, THAT'S ALL HE DOES - WATCH .. would not help, nor answering any question. It amazed me that there is still an easy job out there when everyone is complaining of bad economy. Guess DoubleTree hotel is the place to find the easy job. I paid $101 per night )after adding the parking fee) and will stay there again ONLY if it's the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better for $1400”
Reviews.Author: mlcjvac
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, great pool, nice beds For 2 days we had no bath towels and on second day got damp towels from dryer For 2 days we in the middle of kids sports teams. I don't know why we were not put somewhere were it was going to bwe quiet Things to change.. have enough towels give each room 4 glasses get laundry facilites get rids of the messy looking chairs around fire pit, floppy cushions place sports teams away from other guests don't charge for parking, it's like a stab in the back lock down balconies, they are just loud places for kids and you are next a highway improve friendly-ness at front desk

Reviews.Title: “Lacks apology, cleaning, and attached parking”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: After our stay March 12-16 I have started referring to this place as the Dirty Double Tree, rather that the Doubletree Club San Diego. I can not wait to read the management response to this. Let me guess… “We are sorry you were inconvenienced.” I can’t expect anything else, more about that later. After checking in, driving up the steep hill and navigating the tight $16/night parking garage we hauled our luggage through the garage, down the sidewalk, down the ramp, past the pool and pulled the doors open to actually get inside. Please tell me why the doors to & from the walkway to the parking garage are not automatic at all? I'd even go for the push button for handicap accessibility on one of the doors or something. It would also help if there were luggage carts in the garage, or bell staff that could help with bags or get the door. So we get up to our room and my husband instantly clicks the TV on to catch some March Madness basketball. I look around and start to notice that the room is not clean. It was strange because the bed was made, dirty towels were gone, BUT towels weren't replaced, trash cans were full, there was gunk on the sheets..... What the?! My husband picked up the phone to call the front desk and is asked to hold. No big deal, I just want a new room. 10 minutes later the front desk person picks up and asks if he'll hold again, he said NO! He tells the girl what the problem is and she says that we can come down to get a new room. What's confusing me at this point is why the dirty towels were removed & the bed made, but trash wasn't taken out and towels weren't replaced. I know most hotels don't change the sheets daily, but I've never had the trash not emptied when housekeeping comes in to make the bed & tidy up. We wait at the front desk again. Finally get to the front of the line, pass the keys over while my husband says "I'm the one that called about the dirty room." The response? "Oh, OK," that's it. No “I'm sorry about that.” No “Sorry we weren't aware that housekeeping hadn't serviced that room.” Nothing, just new room # & recoded keys. Our new room was better. Still not super clean but it had been cleaned. The bathroom was your average sized hotel bathroom, nothing thrilling but fine. The beds were the typical DT beds, nice sheets, comfy mattress. Large flat screen TV. In the cabinet under the TV is a mini fridge which was really nice for leftovers, a big plus. The desk area was fine. The couch was comfy. The sliding door lock didn’t work, but on the 3rd floor I wasn’t too concerned since the slide in L shaped metal “lock” was there. Our little rounded balcony looked out over the pool area. Rather The thing was that every night we’d hear all of the kids & families outside in the pool until it closed. Then for some reason after the pool was closed the area around the pool became some sort of hook-up central. There were adults with clothing coming off at least two nights during our stay. Personally, I don’t care if someone was just taking off a jacket, if the pool is closed no one needs to be in that area sharing one lounge chair even cuddling. Go inside and get (into) a (your) room! The drain in our tub was so slow the tub would fill up during one shower. I’m not fond of sitting around in the room in the morning for my husband or I to wait for the tub to drain after the other has showered. It was very par for the course when housekeeping left the hair & soap gunk in the bottom of the tub after they “cleaned” after our first night. I’m sure the housekeeping person just didn’t care that the tub wasn’t draining; it has to be the guests’ job to keep track of those things. So we stopped by the front desk the second morning to let them know that someone had to resolve the tub issue and that the light right inside of our door (the one that is controlled by the switch when you enter the room) had burnt out. I can’t say that I was surprised that a bellman was manning the front desk. It of course took him a while to find something to write our request on. I was actually amazed that they did fix the tub issue and eventually the light too! I know it’s not totally within the hotel’s control, but the people across the hall from us were super loud and obnoxious. The walls in this place are way too thin. From what I saw there were 3 adults and at least 4 kids in that room. Every morning after about 7am they would flip the security latch out so that they could go in & out continuously. That bouncing sound is super when you’re trying to sleep. I’ll also mention the ridiculous rent a cops that just sit & watch TV in the lobby. Glad I can help pay for that too. I would say based on my issues and other reviews those guys probably help get rid of unhappy guests or something. Well, in the past when I’ve had less than stellar hotel stays I have tried not to air all of the details online, I attempt to deal with the hotel first. Since the staff that was on duty through our stay was apathetic at best, that didn’t go anywhere. Only the last day when we were checking out did we see a name for the manager on duty or any sign of the manager. But she was too busy frustrating another guest for us to bother talking to her.
